org.nlpcraft.model.intent

Class NCIntentSolver.NON_CONV_INTENT

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nlpcraft.model.intent.NCIntentSolver.INTENT
      • org.nlpcraft.model.intent.NCIntentSolver.NON_CONV_INTENT
  • Enclosing class:
    NCIntentSolver

    public static class NCIntentSolver.NON_CONV_INTENT
extends NCIntentSolver.INTENT
    Convenient adapter for non-conversational intent.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NON_CONV_INTENT(String id, NCIntentSolver.Predicate pred, int min, int max)
      Shortcut constructor for an exact match, unordered, non-conversational intent with just one TERM.
      NON_CONV_INTENT(String id, NCIntentSolver.TERM... terms)
      Creates new exact match, unordered, intent without conversation support and number of free tokens equal to 3 (which is a good general default value).
      NON_CONV_INTENT(String id, String expr, int min, int max)
      Shortcut constructor for an exact match, unordered, non-conversational intent with just one TERM.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class org.nlpcraft.model.intent.NCIntentSolver.INTENT

        getId, getTerms, isIncludeConversation, isOrdered, toString

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • NON_CONV_INTENT

        public NON_CONV_INTENT(String id,
                       NCIntentSolver.TERM... terms)
        Creates new exact match, unordered, intent without conversation support and number of free tokens equal to 3 (which is a good general default value).

        This is equivalent to: 
             new INTENT(id, false, false, terms);
        Parameters:
        id - Intent ID. It can be any arbitrary string meaningful for the developer. Look at the example for one approach to provide descriptive intent IDs.
        terms - List of terms defining this intent.

      • NON_CONV_INTENT

        public NON_CONV_INTENT(String id,
                       NCIntentSolver.Predicate pred,
                       int min,
                       int max)
        Shortcut constructor for an exact match, unordered, non-conversational intent with just one TERM. It is equivalent to: 
              this(id, new TERM(pred, min, max));
        Parameters:
        id - Intent ID. It can be any arbitrary string meaningful for the developer. Look at the example for one approach to provide descriptive intent IDs.
        pred - Built-in token predicate: either one of the logical combinators or RULE.
        min - Minimum quantifier for this predicate.
        max - Maximum quantifier for this predicate.

      • NON_CONV_INTENT

        public NON_CONV_INTENT(String id,
                       String expr,
                       int min,
                       int max)
        Shortcut constructor for an exact match, unordered, non-conversational intent with just one TERM. It is equivalent to: 
              this(id, new TERM(expr, min, max));
        Parameters:
        id - Intent ID. It can be any arbitrary string meaningful for the developer. Look at the example for one approach to provide descriptive intent IDs.
        expr - Whitespace separated string of parameter, its operation and value for the RULE.
        min - Minimum quantifier for this predicate.
        max - Maximum quantifier for this predicate.
